name: Potassium Chloride

indications.text: potassium chloride extended-release tablets indicated treatment prophylaxis hypokalemia without metabolic alkalosis , patients dietary management potassium-rich foods diuretic dose reduction insufficient .

contraindications.text: monitor serum potassium adjust dosages accordingly ( 2.1 ) serum potassium less 2.5 meq/l , intravenous potassium instead oral supplementation ( 2.1 ) take meals glass water liquid . swallow tablets whole without crushing , chewing sucking . ( 2.1 ) treatment hypokalemia : doses range 40 100 meq/day divided doses . limit doses 40 meq per dose . ( 2.2 ) prevention hypokalemia : typical dose 20 meq per day . ( 2.2 )

warningsAndPrecautions: potassium chloride extended-release tablets usp contains 600 mg 750 mg potassium chloride equivalent 8 meq 10 meq respectively . potassium chloride provided extended-release tablets . potassium chloride extended-release tablets usp 750 mg ( 10 meq ) white off-white , circular , film-coated biconvex tablet debossed “ n 32 ” one side plain side . ndc : 70518-2964-00 ndc : 70518-2964-01 ndc : 70518-2964-02 ndc : 70518-2964-03 ndc : 70518-2964-04 packaging : 30 1 blister pack packaging : 90 1 bottle plastic packaging : 100 1 bottle plastic packaging : 90 1 bottle plastic packaging : 30 1 bottle plastic store 20o 25oc ( 68o 77of ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . protect light moisture . dispense tight , light-resistant container child-resistant closure . repackaged distributed : remedy repack , inc. 625 kolter dr. suite # 4 indiana , pa 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions: potassium chloride contraindicated patients triamterene amiloride .
indications_original: Potassium chloride extended-release tablets are indicated for the treatment and prophylaxis of hypokalemia with or without metabolic alkalosis, in patients for whom dietary management with potassium-rich foods or diuretic dose reduction is insufficient.
contraindications_original: Monitor serum potassium and adjust dosages accordingly (2.1) If serum potassium is less than 2.5 mEq/L, use intravenous potassium instead of oral supplementation (2.1) Take with meals and with a glass of water or other liquid. Swallow tablets whole without crushing, chewing or sucking. (2.1) Treatment of hypokalemia : Doses range from 40 to 100 mEq/day in divided doses. Limit doses to 40 mEq per dose. (2.2) Prevention of hypokalemia : Typical dose is 20 mEq per day. (2.2)
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Potassium Chloride Extended-Release Tablets USP contains 600 mg or 750 mg of potassium chloride equivalent to 8 mEq and 10 mEq respectively. Potassium chloride is provided as extended-release tablets.
                  Potassium Chloride Extended-Release Tablets USP 750 mg (10 mEq) are white to off-white, circular, film-coated biconvex tablet debossed with “N 32” on one side and plain on other side.
                  NDC: 70518-2964-00
                  NDC: 70518-2964-01
                  NDC: 70518-2964-02
                  NDC: 70518-2964-03
                  NDC: 70518-2964-04
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  PACKAGING: 90 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  PACKAGING: 100 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  PACKAGING: 90 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC 
                  
                  
                  Store at 20o to 25oC (68o to 77oF) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature]. Protect from light and moisture.
                  Dispense in a tight, light-resistant container with a child-resistant closure.
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions_original: Potassium chloride is contraindicated in patients on triamterene and amiloride.
